item.text: After this Jesus revealed himself again to the disciples by the Sea of Tiberias. Now this is how he did so.

<st data-num="4613" class="">Simon</st> <st data-num="4074" class="">Peter</st>, <st data-num="2381" class="">Thomas</st><n id="1" /> (<st data-num="3004">called</st> <st data-num="1324" class="">Didymus)</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="3482" class="">Nathanael</st><n id="3" /> (who was <st data-num="575" class="">from</st> <st data-num="2580" class="">Cana</st><n id="4" /> in <st data-num="1056">Galilee</st>), the sons<n id="5" /> of <st data-num="2199" class="">Zebedee</st>,<n id="6" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1417" class="">two</st> <st data-num="243" class="">other</st> <st data-num="3101" class="">disciples</st><n id="7" /> of <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">were</st> <st data-num="3674" class="">together</st>.
Simon Peter told them, “I am going fishing.” “We will go with you,” they replied. They went out and got into the boat, but that night they caught nothing.
When it was already very early morning, Jesus stood on the beach, but the disciples did not know that it was Jesus.

<st data-num="3767" class="">So</st> <st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st> <st data-num="3004" class="">said</st> to <st data-num="846" class="">them</st>, “<st data-num="3813">Children</st>, you <st data-num="3361">don’t</st> <st data-num="2192" class="">have</st> <st data-num="5100" class="">any</st> <st data-num="4371" class="">fish</st>,<n id="1" /> do you?”<n id="2" /> They <st data-num="611" class="">replied</st>,<n id="3" /> “<st data-num="3756">No</st>.”
He told them, “Throw your net on the right side of the boat, and you will find some.” So they threw the net and were not able to pull it in because of the large number of fish.

Then the disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It is the Lord!” So Simon Peter, when he heard that it was the Lord, tucked in his outer garment (for he had nothing on underneath it), and plunged into the sea.
Meanwhile the other disciples came with the boat, dragging the net full of fish, for they were not far from land, only about a hundred yards.
When they got out on the beach, they saw a charcoal fire ready with a fish placed on it, and bread.

<st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st> <st data-num="3004" class="">said</st>,<n id="1" /> “<st data-num="5342">Bring</st> some <st data-num="575" class="">of</st> the <st data-num="3795" class="">fish</st> you have <st data-num="3568">just now</st> <st data-num="4084" class="">caught</st>.”

<st data-num="3767" class="">So</st> <st data-num="4613" class="">Simon</st> <st data-num="4074" class="">Peter</st> went <st data-num="305" class="">aboard</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1670" class="">pulled</st> the <st data-num="1350" class="">net</st> <st data-num="1519" class="">to</st> <st data-num="1093" class="">shore</st>. It was<n id="1" /> <st data-num="3324" class="">full</st> of <st data-num="3173" class="">large</st> <st data-num="2486" class="">fish</st>, <st data-num="1540 4004 5140">153</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">but</st> although there <st data-num="1510" class="">were</st> <st data-num="5118">so many</st>, the <st data-num="1350" class="">net</st> was <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="4977" class="">torn</st>.

“<st data-num="1204">Come</st>, <st data-num="709">have breakfast</st>,” <st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st> <st data-num="3004" class="">said</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="1161">But</st> <st data-num="3762" class="">none</st> of the <st data-num="3101" class="">disciples</st> <st data-num="5111" class="">dared</st> to <st data-num="1833" class="">ask</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>, “<st data-num="5101">Who</st> are <st data-num="1510" class="">you</st>?” <st data-num="3754" class="">because</st> they <st data-num="1492" class="">knew</st> it <st data-num="1510" class="">was</st> the <st data-num="2962" class="">Lord</st>.

<st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st> <st data-num="2064" class="">came</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="2983" class="">took</st> the <st data-num="740" class="">bread</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1325" class="">gave</st> it to <st data-num="846" class="">them</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> did the <st data-num="3668" class="">same</st> with the <st data-num="3795" class="">fish</st>.
This was now the third time Jesus was revealed to the disciples after he was raised from the dead.

Then when they had finished breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of John, do you love me more than these do?” He replied, “Yes, Lord, you know I love you.” Jesus told him, “Feed my lambs.”

Jesus<n id="1" /> <st data-num="3004" class="">said</st><n id="2" /> a <st data-num="1208">second time</st>, “<st data-num="4613">Simon</st>, son of <st data-num="2491" class="">John</st>, do you <st data-num="25">love</st> <st data-num="1473" class="">me</st>?” He <st data-num="3004" class="">replied</st>,<n id="3" /> “<st data-num="3483">Yes</st>, <st data-num="2962" class="">Lord</st>, <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> <st data-num="1492" class="">know</st> I <st data-num="5368" class="">love</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st>.” Jesus<n id="4" /> <st data-num="3004" class="">told</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>, “<st data-num="4165">Shepherd</st> <st data-num="1473" class="">my</st> <st data-num="4263" class="">sheep</st>.”

Jesus<n id="1" /> <st data-num="3004" class="">said</st><n id="2" /> a <st data-num="5154" class="">third time</st>, “<st data-num="4613" class="">Simon</st>, son of <st data-num="2491" class="">John</st>, do you <st data-num="5368" class="">love</st> <st data-num="1473" class="">me</st>?” <st data-num="4074" class="">Peter</st> was <st data-num="3076" class="">distressed</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="3754" class="">that</st> Jesus<n id="4" /> <st data-num="3004" class="">asked</st><n id="5" /> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> a <st data-num="5154" class="">third time</st>, “Do you <st data-num="5368" class="">love</st> <st data-num="1473" class="">me</st>?” <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="3004" class="">said</st>,<n id="6" /> “<st data-num="2962">Lord</st>, <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> <st data-num="1097" class="">know</st> <st data-num="3956" class="">everything</st>. <st data-num="4771" class="">You</st> <st data-num="1097" class="">know</st> <st data-num="3754" class="">that</st> I <st data-num="5368" class="">love</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st>.” Jesus<n id="7" /> <st data-num="3004" class="">replied</st>,<n id="8" /> “<st data-num="1006">Feed</st> <st data-num="1473" class="">my</st> <st data-num="4263" class="">sheep</st>.

I <st data-num="3004" class="">tell</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> the <st data-num="281" class="">solemn</st> <st data-num="281" class="">truth</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="3753">when</st> you <st data-num="1510" class="">were</st> <st data-num="3501" class="">young</st>, you <st data-num="2224" class="">tied</st> your <st data-num="2224" class="">clothes around</st> <st data-num="4572" class="">you</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="4043" class="">went</st> <st data-num="3699" class="">wherever</st> you <st data-num="2309" class="">wanted</st>, <st data-num="1161" class="">but</st> <st data-num="3752" class="">when</st> you <st data-num="1095">are old</st>, you will stretch <st data-num="1614" class="">out</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">your</st> <st data-num="5495" class="">hands</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="243" class="">others</st> will <st data-num="2224" class="">tie</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> <st data-num="2224" class="">up</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="5342" class="">bring</st> you <st data-num="3699" class="">where</st> you do <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="2309" class="">want</st> to go.”
(Now Jesus said this to indicate clearly by what kind of death Peter was going to glorify God.) After he said this, Jesus told Peter, “Follow me.”

Peter turned around and saw the disciple whom Jesus loved following them. (This was the disciple who had leaned back against Jesus’ chest at the meal and asked, “Lord, who is the one who is going to betray you?”)

<st data-num="3767" class="">So</st> when <st data-num="4074" class="">Peter</st> <st data-num="1492" class="">saw</st> <st data-num="3778" class="">him</st>,<n id="1" /> he <st data-num="3004" class="">asked</st> <st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st>, “<st data-num="2962">Lord</st>, <st data-num="5101" class="">what</st> about <st data-num="3778" class="">him</st>?”

<st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st> <st data-num="3004" class="">replied</st>,<n id="1" /> “<st data-num="1437" class="">If</st> I <st data-num="2309" class="">want</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> to <st data-num="3306">live</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="2193">until</st> I come <st data-num="2064">back</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="5101" class="">what</st> concern is that of <st data-num="4314" class="">yours</st>? <st data-num="4771" class="">You</st> <st data-num="190" class="">follow</st> <st data-num="1473" class="">me</st>!”

So the saying circulated among the brothers and sisters that this disciple was not going to die. But Jesus did not say to him that he was not going to die, but rather, “If I want him to live until I come back, what concern is that of yours?”
This is the disciple who testifies about these things and has written these things, and we know that his testimony is true.
There are many other things that Jesus did. If every one of them were written down, I suppose the whole world would not have room for the books that would be written.
